gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Panels.Contour.Contours
Class OrderedContours

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Panels.Contour.Contours.Contours
      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Panels.Contour.Contours.MixedContours
          gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Panels.Contour.Contours.OrderedContours
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState
public class OrderedContours
extends MixedContours

This class is used to fuse a UniformContours and NonUniformContours object together to form a set of nonuniform contour levels sorted in increasing order.

Field Detail

CONTOUR_LEVELS_KEY

public static final java.lang.String CONTOUR_LEVELS_KEY
This static constant String is a key used for referencing the array of contour levels encapsulated by this class. The value that this key references is a float array.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DEFAULT_CONTOUR_LEVELS

public static final float[] DEFAULT_CONTOUR_LEVELS
The default set of contour levels that this class encapsulates.

Constructor Detail

OrderedContours

public OrderedContours()
Creates a default collection of ordered contour levels.

OrderedContours

public OrderedContours(UniformContours uniformContours,
                       NonUniformContours nonuniformContours)
Creates an OrderedContours object with the parameters as specified such that no contour levels in the collection of contour levels are repeated. Notice: uniformContours cannot be null. However, nonuniformContours can be. In this case, the levels will precisely be uniformly spaced contour levels.

Parameters:
uniformContours - Encapsulates the uniformlly spaced contour levels.
nonuniformContours - Encapsulates the nonuniformlly spaced contour levels.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If uniformContours is null or if the total number of levels in the UniformContours and NonUniformContours is 0.

OrderedContours

public OrderedContours(UniformContours uniformContours,
                       NonUniformContours nonuniformContours,
                       boolean ignoreRepeats)
Creates an OrderedContours object with the parameters as specified. Notice: uniformContours cannot be null. However, nonuniformContours can be. In this case, the levels will precisely be uniformly spaced contour levels.

Parameters:
uniformContours - Encapsulates the uniformlly spaced contour levels.
nonuniformContours - Encapsulates the nonuniformlly spaced contour levels.
ignoreRepeats - Suppose the raw list of contour levels is {-1.2, 1.0, 2.0, 2.0, 3.5, 5}. If this parameter is true then the list used is exactly this list. If this parameter is false, the extra 2.0 will be ignored. Thus, the list that would be used is {-1.2, 1.0, 2.0, 3.5, 5}.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If uniformContours is null or if the total number of levels in the UniformContours and NonUniformContours is 0.
Method Detail

getObjectState

public ObjectState getObjectState(boolean isDefault)
Used to get the state information for this collection of contour levels. This method is overriden to include the float array of ordered contours in the state information.

Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Overrides:
getObjectState in class Contours
Parameters:
isDefault - If true, the default state for this collection of contour levels is returned. If false, the current state is returned.
Returns:
The state for this collection of contour levels.
See Also:
getObjectState(boolean)

setObjectState

public void setObjectState(ObjectState state)
Used to set the state information for this collection of ordered cohtour levels. This method is overriden to allow the float array of contours to be stored in the state.

Specified by:
setObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Overrides:
setObjectState in class Contours
Parameters:
state - An encapsulation of the state information for this collection of contour levels.
See Also:
setObjectState(ObjectState)
